body.name: Selector Shaft, Selector Forks and Drum - Removal (kais_2)

body.body: The selector forks can be fitted incorrectly. Ensure the position and orientation of the selector forks are marked prior to removal. Incorrect fitting of the selector forks will cause damage to the transmission.

body.name: Selector Shaft, Selector Forks and Drum - Installation (kait)

body.body: Remove the circlips from the selector shaft.
Using a suitable tool, push the selector shaft out from the crankcase in the direction of the selector shaft plug. Collect each selector fork as they are released by the selector shaft.
If not already removed, note the position and orientation of the gear pedal crank in relation to the shaft, then remove the pedal.
Remove the E-clip and washer from the gear pedal end of the gear change shaft.

body.name: Selector Shaft, Selector Forks and Drum - Removal (kakh_2)

body.body: Withdraw the gear change shaft from the clutch end of the crankcase and collect the washer from inside the crankcase.

body.name: Selector Shaft, Selector Forks and Drum - Installation (cgwj_1)

body.body: The detent arm is held in position under spring pressure. Prior to removal, note the orientation of the detent arm, fixing, spring and washer. The same orientation must be retained on assembly.

body.name: Selector Shaft, Selector Forks and Drum - Installation (cfao_2)

body.body: Release and remove the fixing securing the detent arm.
Withdraw the detent arm complete with its spring and washer. Unhook the spring from the bearing keeper plate as the detent arm is withdrawn. Discard the fixing.

Take care to avoid damaging the oil pressure relief valve when inserting a suitable tool into the selector drum. A damaged oil pressure relief valve may lead to oil pressure loss and could result in engine damage.
To prevent drum rotation, use a suitable tool through one of the through-holes in the drum. Care must be taken not to damage the oil pressure relief valve.
Remove the fixing from the centre of the detent wheel (discard the fixing) and withdraw the wheel.
Release and remove the fixing securing the selector drum bearing to the crankcase. Discard the fixing.

body.name: Selector Shaft, Selector Forks and Drum - Installation (kaiu_2)

body.body: Ease the selector drum backwards and forwards to release the drum bearing out of the crankcase.
Withdraw the drum from within the crankcase.
